list_definition.mean_english: can đảm; chẳng sợ cái gì

list_ex_of_english: Tenure to ensure fearless performance of duty was standard in the case of judges, but the underlying principle was by no means reserved to them.
It is more accurate to conclude that a high reactive temperament constrains the probability of becoming a consistently fearless, uninhibited child.
What terrifies you, my fearless heart?
Octaves and fifths appear in fearless consecutiveness, and parts cross, drift apart or simply disappear.
Conversely, uninhibited children "display a relatively rapid and fearless approach to unfamiliar people, places, and objects" during similar situations.
The teacher needs to be a good role model as a singer, fearless in leadership and demonstration, solicitous and sympathetic in the capacity to encourage.
In the cabaletta she claims a new identity as a fearless woman warrior, stepping into the hero's place fully and unproblematically.
Despite being warned many times by all the officials, they are fearless.
